content.question: Which of the following phylogenetic trees best illustrates (with the X) the point at which the mutation in the GULO gene most likely occurred during the evolutionary history of these organisms?

choices.label: The figure shows a phylogenetic tree. From left to right, the ancestral lineage splits at the first node into an upper branch and a lower branch. The lower branch is labeled Nonprimate. The upper branch splits at the next node into a lower branch labeled Lemur, and an upper branch, with a point labeled X, and splits at the next node into three branches, the lower labeled Orangutan, the middle labeled Chimpanzee, and the upper labeled Human.

The figure shows a phylogenetic tree. From left to right, the ancestral lineage splits at the first node into an upper branch and a lower branch. The lower branch splits at the next node into a lower branch labeled Nonprimate and an upper branch labeled Lemur. The branch labeled Lemur has a point labeled X. From the main ancestral lineage, the upper branch splits at the next node into three branches, the lower labeled Orangutan, the middle labeled Chimpanzee, and the upper labeled Human.

The figure shows a phylogenetic tree. From left to right, the ancestral lineage splits at the first node into an upper branch and a lower branch. The lower branch splits at the next node into a lower branch labeled Nonprimate and an upper branch labeled Lemur. The branch labeled Nonprimate has a point labeled X. From the main ancestral lineage, the upper branch splits at the next node into two branches, the upper branch is labeled Human, and the lower branch splits at the next node into an upper and a lower branch. The lower branch is labeled Orangutan, and the upper branch is labeled Chimpanzee.

The figure shows a phylogenetic tree. From left to right, the ancestral lineage, which has a point labeled X, splits at the first node into an upper and a lower branch. The lower branch splits at the next node into an upper branch labeled Lemur and a lower branch labeled Nonprimate. From the main ancestral lineage, the upper branch splits at the next node into three branches, the lower labeled Orangutan, the middle labeled Chimpanzee, and the upper labeled Human.

content.answer: The figure shows a phylogenetic tree. From left to right, the ancestral lineage splits at the first node into an upper branch and a lower branch. The lower branch is labeled Nonprimate. The upper branch splits at the next node into a lower branch labeled Lemur, and an upper branch, with a point labeled X, and splits at the next node into three branches, the lower labeled Orangutan, the middle labeled Chimpanzee, and the upper labeled Human.

skill.text: 2.C: Explain how biological models relate to larger principles, concepts, processes, systems, or theories.
